meanings.definition: Find out for certain; make sure of.
meanings.sent1: She was ascertaining the answer by asking many questions.
meanings.sent2: The detective was ascertaining the culprit's identity through fingerprints.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat was ascertaining the source of the mysterious sound.
meanings.sent4: His intuition was like a compass, ascertaining the right path to take.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment was aimed at ascertaining the truth behind the theory.

meanings.sent1: The explorer was ascertaining the location of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: By examining the map closely, she was ascertaining the correct route to take.
meanings.sent3: The magician was ascertaining the secret behind the disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like detectives, ascertaining every detail in the room.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist's brush delicately moved, ascertaining the age of the fossil.
